issue.title: WIP: Landing Page
issue.body:
For consistency reasons I started to adapt the design @bmikaili put together in his repo using React + antDesign. Feel free to provide feedback 🤩

fixes #5

issue.title: Ccssmnn/gitpod setup
issue.body:
This PR adds:
- a Gitpod config
- a ready to code button to launch this repo in Gitpod
- updated README in projects root
- removed README in app
- updated package.json's
- fix compile warnings and remove console.log in rendering

issue.title: Hold expression for 1-3 seconds when in practise mode
issue.body: When user is in forming expressions view wrong detections can result into skipping of tasks. We should ask the user to keep the expression for a view seconds.

issue.title: Multi Language support
issue.body: Instead of writing the texts directly into the components we could use json files for our texts. One file per language or so? We can start with english & german and ask users to contribute translations

issue.title: Multi Language support
issue.body: Instead of writing the texts directly into the components we could use json files for our texts. One file per language or so? We can start with english & german and ask users to contribute translations

issue.title: Ask users to provide facial expression data
issue.body: We could enhance our facial expression feature once we have more data of different facial expressions. This data can be provided (or donated) by users to help us improving our service

issue.title: Pong mobile friendly
issue.body:
Make pong usable on mobile devices. Maybe only in landscape mode?

Write it in TypeScript

issue.title: improve user landing page
issue.body:
We should provide the users with more information than we do today.

- Emotions: What emotions we are addressing and definitions or descriptions of these emotions.
- How we help: Our approach to the problem. E.g. different phases during training and playing
- How we respect privacy
- Who we are
- That we are open for help (from developers) or donations (patreon?)

issue.title: tests
issue.body: do we want this project to be tested?

issue.title: highscores
issue.body:
We could support individual high scores and some success statistics to the user.

This of course needs user accounts and a database in the backend. We can continue respecting privacy by only asking for username, mail and password. I wouldn't recommend cookies because then high scores are locked to the device.

Maybe this feature should be only available for supporters in order to get the servers paid?
